availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Woodall (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Jane Woodall. Father of Fannie Woodall, Mary Woodall, James Woodall, and Sarah Woodall. Farmer in Lafayette County, Missouri, in 1850. Farmer in Fredonia, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed S. A. Woodall as a farmhand in Fredonia in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Lafayette County, District 46, p. 231B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 170.
"James S. Woodall (1828-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46985118, accessed December 21, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46985118.
